verses.verse: As snow <S%H7950><s%> in summer <S%H7019><s%>, and as rain <S%H4306><s%> in harvest <S%H7105><s%>, So honor <S%H3519><s%> is not seemly <S%H5000><s%> for a fool <S%H3684><s%>.

As the sparrow <S%H6833><s%> in her wandering <S%H5110><s%>, as the swallow <S%H1866><s%> in her flying <S%H5774><s%>, So the curse <S%H7045><s%> that is causeless <S%H2600><s%> alighteth not <S%H935><s%>.
A whip <S%H7752><s%> for the horse <S%H5483><s%>, a bridle <S%H4964><s%> for the ass <S%H2543><s%>, And a rod <S%H7626><s%> for the back <S%H1460><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%>.
Answer <S%H6030><s%> not a fool <S%H3684><s%> according to his folly <S%H200><s%>, Lest thou also be like unto him <S%H7737><s%>.
Answer <S%H6030><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> according to his folly <S%H200><s%>, Lest he be wise <S%H2450><s%> in his own conceit <S%H5869><s%>.

He that sendeth <S%H7971><s%> a message <S%H1697><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> Cutteth off <S%H7096><s%> his own feet <S%H7272><s%>, and drinketh <S%H8354><s%> in damage <S%H2555><s%>.
The legs <S%H7785><s%> of the lame <S%H6455><s%> hang loose <S%H1809><s%>: So is a parable <S%H4912><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%>.
As one that bindeth <S%H6872><s%> a stone <S%H68><s%> in a sling <S%H4773><s%>, So is he that giveth <S%H5414><s%> honor <S%H3519><s%> to a fool <S%H3684><s%>.
As a thorn <S%H2336><s%> that goeth up <S%H5927><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a drunkard <S%H7910><s%>, So is a parable <S%H4912><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%>.
As an archer <S%H7227><s%> that woundeth <S%H2342><s%> all <S%H7936><s%>, So is he that hireth a fool <S%H3684><s%> and he that hireth <S%H7936><s%> them that pass by <S%H5674><s%>.
As a dog <S%H3611><s%> that returneth <S%H7725><s%> to his vomit <S%H6892><s%>, So is a fool <S%H3684><s%> that repeateth <S%H8138><s%> his folly <S%H200><s%>.
Seest <S%H7200><s%> thou a man <S%H376><s%> wise <S%H2450><s%> in his own conceit <S%H5869><s%>? There is more hope <S%H8615><s%> of a fool than of him <S%H3684><s%>.
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> saith <S%H559><s%>, There is a lion <S%H7826><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%>; A lion <S%H7826><s%> is in the streets <S%H7339><s%>.
As the door <S%H1817><s%> turneth <S%H5437><s%> upon its hinges <S%H6735><s%>, So doth the sluggard <S%H6102><s%> upon his bed <S%H4296><s%>.
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> burieth <S%H2934><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> in the dish <S%H6747><s%>; It wearieth <S%H3811><s%> him to bring it again <S%H7725><s%> to his mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> is wiser <S%H2450><s%> in his own conceit <S%H5869><s%> Than seven men <S%H7651><s%> that can render <S%H7725><s%> a reason <S%H2940><s%>.
He that passeth by <S%H5674><s%>, and vexeth <S%H5674><s%> himself with strife <S%H7379><s%> belonging not to him <S%H2388><s%>, Is like one that taketh a dog <S%H3611><s%> by the ears <S%H241><s%>.
As a madman <S%H3856><s%> who casteth <S%H3384><s%> firebrands <S%H2131><s%>, Arrows <S%H2671><s%>, and death <S%H4194><s%>,
So is the man <S%H376><s%> that deceiveth <S%H7411><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%>, And saith <S%H559><s%>, Am not I in sport <S%H7832><s%>?
For lack <S%H657><s%> of wood <S%H6086><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%> goeth out <S%H3518><s%>; And where there is no whisperer <S%H5372><s%>, contention <S%H4066><s%> ceaseth <S%H8367><s%>.
As coals <S%H6352><s%> are to hot embers <S%H1513><s%>, and wood <S%H6086><s%> to fire <S%H784><s%>, So is a contentious <S%H4079><s%> man <S%H376><s%> to inflame <S%H2787><s%> strife <S%H7379><s%>.
The words <S%H1697><s%> of a whisperer <S%H5372><s%> are as dainty morsels <S%H3859><s%>, And they go down <S%H3381><s%> into the innermost <S%H990><s%> parts <S%H2315><s%>.
Fervent <S%H1814><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> and a wicked <S%H7451><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> Are like an earthen <S%H2789><s%> vessel overlaid <S%H6823><s%> with silver <S%H3701><s%> dross <S%H5509><s%>.
He that hateth <S%H8130><s%> dissembleth <S%H5234><s%> with his lips <S%H8193><s%>; But he layeth up <S%H7896><s%> deceit <S%H4820><s%> within him <S%H7130><s%>:
When he speaketh <S%H6963><s%> fair <S%H2603><s%>, believe <S%H539><s%> him not <S%H7651><s%>; For there are seven abominations <S%H8441><s%> in his heart <S%H3820><s%>:
Though his hatred <S%H8135><s%> cover <S%H3680><s%> itself with guile <S%H4860><s%>, His wickedness <S%H7451><s%> shall be openly showed <S%H1540><s%> before the assembly <S%H6951><s%>.
Whoso diggeth <S%H3738><s%> a pit <S%H7845><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> therein <S%H1556><s%>; And he that rolleth a stone <S%H68><s%>, it shall return upon him <S%H7725><s%>.
A lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> hateth <S%H8130><s%> those whom it hath wounded <S%H1790><s%>; And a flattering <S%H2509><s%> mouth <S%H6310><s%> worketh <S%H6213><s%> ruin <S%H4072><s%>.
